## Conservation & rarity context

-   IUCN: Least Concern; Florida: Common winter visitor
-   **Rarity note:** This bird is commonly found in north and central Florida during the winter.

## Natural history notes

The Chipping Sparrow (Spizella passerina) is a small songbird with a broad range that includes parts of Alaska, Canada, nearly all of the lower 48 states, Mexico, and the Caribbean. It inhabits forests and primarily feeds on seeds. In Florida, the Chipping Sparrow is a winter visitor. Adults are easily recognized by their distinctive rufous cap.
